newsitem.title: USA: MCI jumps on BT report.
newsitem.headline: MCI jumps on BT report.

text.p: Shares of MCI Communications Corp shot up 5-5/8 to 30-3/4 after CNBC-TV reported that British Telecommunications PLC was negotiating to buy the remaining 80 percent stake in MCI.

"It makes sense," said Kevin Haggerty, senior vice president and manager of equity trading at Fidelity Investments. "I think BT is a great company. The synergy is there. BT made a great initial investment."
BT currently owns 20 percent of MCI.

"BT has a great presence here, in things like systems on brokerage desks," said Haggerty. "This would complete the communications side. It all goes hand in hand to get an integrated company. It's a good do."
"I guess we'll know on Monday morning, whether you should have been short or long (on MCI); the tape is telling you something is going to happen," said another trader.
Market analysts also saw the combination as a positive.

"This is an extremely competitive business, and horizontal mergers like this make sense," said Allen Sinai, chief economist at Lehman Brothers Global Economic Advisors. "The economies of scale in this case could be considerable, and the leverage in terms of potential profits is high...It would be a good purchase."
Thom Brown, managing director of Rutherford Brown and Catherwood, liked the deal. "It would be a good fit for British Telecom and provide a major foothold in this country," said Brown.
"It would be a feather in British Telecom's cap," said Brown. "It wouldn't take away from the long-distance battle. Before that's over, there will be losers and winners."
